intro: Grumilea euchrysantha, commonly known as the golden grumihua, is a striking plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture, and its stems are often covered in soft, fuzzy hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
